studyTitles.text: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840
Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

studyArms.name: ALXN1840
studyArms.description: Participants receive ALXN1840 15 mg/day for approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 1 (Treatment-experienced)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received WD therapy for > 28 days

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 2 (Treatment-naïve)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received WD therapy for ≤ 28 days

objectives.name: Primary Objective 1
objectives.text: Assess net copper balance with daily repeat-dose ALXN1840 treatment (15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with Wilson disease (WD)

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 1
objectives.text: Assess change in copper balance in response to ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day during ALXN1840 accumulation and at steady state periods versus the pretreatment baseline in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 2
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 (15 mg/day and 30 mg/day) on the disposition of copper in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 3
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 on the disposition of molybdenum at steady state at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 4
objectives.text: Assess steady-state total molybdenum balance as a measure of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 5
objectives.text: Assess accumulation of molybdenum with ALXN1840 treatment at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 6
objectives.text: Determine the steady-state plasma pharmacokinetic (PK) of total molybdenum and plasma ultrafiltrate (PUF) molybdenum (as surrogate measures of ALXN1840, 15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 7
objectives.text: Evaluate the safety and tolerability of repeated-dose administration of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 1
objectives.text: Determine dose response of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day for copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 2
objectives.text: Determine the effect of treatment duration on copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 3
objectives.text: Assess the effects of ALXN1840 on ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper LBC profiles in plasma in participants with WD

endpoints.name: Primary Endpoint 1
endpoints.text: Mean daily copper balance where copper balance is measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 2
endpoints.text: Change in mean daily copper balance as measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) from pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1) and ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 3
endpoints.text: Copper quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, including plasma total and labile bound copper (LBC) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 4
endpoints.text: Molybdenum quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, plasma total molybdenum at ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 5
endpoints.text: Mean daily molybdenum balance as demonstrated through measurement of molybdenum intake (in food, drink and ALXN1840), and molybdenum output (feces and urine) representing ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 6
endpoints.text: Accumulation of molybdenum as determined by molybdenum balance

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 7
endpoints.text: PK parameters for plasma total and PUF-molybdenum

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 8
endpoints.text: Safety parameters: • Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)/serious adverse events (SAEs) • Clinical laboratory assessments (serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and urinalysis) • Physical examinations • Heart rate, intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc), and clinically significant electrocardiogram (ECG) findings as determined by triplicate 12-lead ECG • Vital sign assessments (blood pressure and heart rate)

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 9
endpoints.text: Assess dose response of ALXN1840 on copper balance focusing on copper balance

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 10
endpoints.text: Determine the effect of time following initiation of ALXN1840 treatment on copper balance

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 11
endpoints.text: Ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and LBC: Change in ceruloplasmin at Days 1, 8, 25, 29, 36, and Day 39 compared with predose

studyInterventions.name: ALXN1840
studyInterventions.description: Bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate (formerly WTX101), a novel copper binding agent

studyInterventions.name: Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet
studyInterventions.description: Standardized copper- and molybdenum-controlled meals provided during inpatient periods to support balance measurements

activities.name: HIV, hepatitis B and C screen
activities.description: Screen for HIV, hepatitis B and C

activities.name: Height, weight, and BMI
activities.description: Height, weight, and Body Mass Index

activities.name: Blood sampling for PK/PD
activities.description: Blood sampling for PK: Plasma total Mo and PUF-Mo; PD: Plasma total and PUF-Cu, LBC, ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound Cu

activities.name: Chemistry, hematology, Coagulation
activities.description: Safety laboratory analyses: Chemistry, hematology, Coagulation

activities.name: Urination and bowel movement monitoring, menstruation checks
activities.description: Urination and bowel movement monitoring, menstruation checks

activities.name: 24-hour urine for Cu and Mo
activities.description: 24-hour urine collection for Copper and Molybdenum

activities.name: Feces for Cu and Mo
activities.description: Feces collection for Copper and Molybdenum

activities.name: Concomitant medication and non-pharmacologic therapy/procedure
activities.description: Concomitant medication and non-pharmacologic therapy/procedure monitoring

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdic acid
substances.description: Active moiety (7.8 mg contained in 15 mg ALXN1840)

studyDefinitionDocument.name: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

studyAmendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update procedures outlined in the Schedule of Activities, remove contradictory text on the reporting of serious adverse events, and add details of an interim analysis.

The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to revise the exclusion criterion for a urine drug screen. Changes implemented via Administrative Letter 1 and Administrative Letter 2, as well as COVID vaccination guidance, have also been incorporated.
The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update the washout period for zinc.

The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.

procedures.name: Blood Sampling for PK/PD
procedures.label: PK/PD Blood Draw
procedures.description: Collection of blood samples for pharmacokinetic (Plasma total Mo and PUF-Mo) and pharmacodynamic (Plasma total and PUF-Cu, LBC, ceruloplasmin) analysis

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture

procedures.name: 24-hour Urine Collection
procedures.label: Urine Collection
procedures.description: Collection of urine over a 24-hour period for measurement of copper and molybdenum content

code.decode: Volume measurement for timed collection, each 24 hours

procedures.name: Fecal Collection
procedures.label: Stool Collection
procedures.description: Individual collection of fecal samples with record of date, time, and weight for measurement of copper and molybdenum content

code.decode: Blood, occult, by peroxidase activity (e.g., guaiac), qualitative; feces, consecutive collected specimens with single determination

procedures.name: Physical Examination
procedures.label: Physical Exam
procedures.description: Complete physical examination including assessments of cardiovascular, respiratory, gastrointestinal, and neurological systems

code.decode: Office or other outpatient visit for the evaluation and management of a new patient

procedures.name: Vital Signs Assessment
procedures.label: Vitals
procedures.description: Measurement of body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure

procedures.name: 12-Lead Electrocardiogram
procedures.label: ECG
procedures.description: Triplicate 12-lead ECG to assess heart rate, intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc), and clinically significant findings

code.decode: Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads; with interpretation and report

procedures.name: Food and Fluid Collection
procedures.label: Dietary Collection
procedures.description: Collection of samples of all meal and fluid batches for analysis of copper and molybdenum content

procedures.name: Pregnancy Test
procedures.label: Pregnancy Screen
procedures.description: Serum or urine pregnancy testing for females of childbearing potential

code.decode: Urine pregnancy test, by visual color comparison methods

procedures.name: Neurological Assessment
procedures.label: Neuro Exam
procedures.description: Assessment of neurological systems as part of the physical examination

procedures.name: Bowel and Urine Monitoring
procedures.label: Output Monitoring
procedures.description: Monitoring of urination and bowel movements

medicalDevices.name: Automated Blood Pressure Device
medicalDevices.label: BP Monitor
medicalDevices.description: Automated device for assessing blood pressure and heart rate

medicalDevices.name: 12-Lead ECG Machine
medicalDevices.label: ECG Device
medicalDevices.description: Device used for recording triplicate 12-lead electrocardiograms

medicalDevices.name: Cannula
medicalDevices.label: Cannula
medicalDevices.description: Placed to minimize needle sticks for repeated blood draws

medicalDevices.name: Male Condom
medicalDevices.label: Condom
medicalDevices.description: Barrier contraception required for male participants

conditions.name: Renal Failure Exclusion
conditions.description: Exclusion criteria based on renal function
conditions.text: End-stage renal disease on dialysis (chronic kidney disease [CKD] stage 5) or creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min

conditions.name: Alcohol Abuse Exclusion
conditions.description: Exclusion criteria based on alcohol consumption
conditions.text: Regular weekly intake of more than 14 units

conditions.name: Liver Safety Threshold
conditions.description: Safety trigger for dose interruption (Hy's Law indicators)
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 x ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 x ULN

conditions.name: Hematology Drop Threshold
conditions.text: Hemoglobin or Platelets > 30% decrease from baseline

conditions.name: SRC Review Requirement
conditions.text: Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30mg
transitionRules.text: Titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29. Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Hematology
transitionRules.text: Reduce dose to previous dose level if up-titration has occurred or reduce dose to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD. No further dose increase until resolution.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: Temporary interruption if Bilirubin > 2x ULN accompanied by ALT > 3x ULN

transitionRules.name: Outpatient Period Extension
transitionRules.text: Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval

transitionRules.name: Post-Study Transition
transitionRules.text: Transition to therapy that was discontinued before enrollment, or transition to other standard of care therapy, or continuation of ALXN1840

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participant completes all phases including last scheduled procedure

commentAnnotations.text: This amendment is considered to be substantial based on the criteria set forth in Article 10(a) of Directive 2001/20/EC... and 21 CFR part 312.30(b)
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Protocol Amendment Summary of Changes Table

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigator’s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Protocol Amendment 3.1 (US) clarifying study procedures across different US sites

studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added footnote text regarding procedures specific to screening sites in the US

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 4.2 - Scientific Rationale for Study Design
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated the number of days for zinc discontinuation effect
Added text allowing US sites to perform only screening procedures without remaining study procedures

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study
To align the number of days with the mention of zinc discontinuation elsewhere in the protocol

studyChanges.afterText: Procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
studyChanges.summary: Added text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8

studyChanges.beforeText: expected to be minimal 30 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.afterText: expected to be minimal 21 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.summary: Number of days changed from 30 days to 21 days regarding the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption

studyChanges.afterText: Text applicable only to the US that details the possibility for sites in the US to only perform screening procedures and not any of the remaining study procedures.
studyChanges.summary: Added provision for US sites to potentially only perform screening procedures
